intro: Caucanthus platanifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf caucanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that resemble the leaves of the plane tree, hence its common name. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Caucanthus platanifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine.
